head.supplied: Melbourne bot. Garden, ¶ 19. Sept. 1863. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor of submitting a letter from my assistant, ¶ in whose sentiments I fully concur & having on various occasions remonstrated against ...

div.p: Unit 731, VPRS 3181/P Town Clerk's file series 1, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
I have the honor of submitting a letter from my assistant,
E. Heyne to M, 19 September 1863. in whose sentiments I fully concur & having on various occasions remonstrated against the bathing at the bot. Gardens landing place unsuccessfully, I trust you will kindly aid me by your official influence in suppressing an evil, to which I see no cessation except by the positive prohibition of bathing at any hour at any place on the river except the locality specially selected at the bathing house.
See also E. FitzGibbon to M, 21 September 1863.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,
